thag5.2:5.1: When a person, wishing for a certain outcome,
thag5.2:5.2: applies themselves in a misguided endeavor;
thag5.2:5.3: not achieving what they worked for,
thag5.2:5.4: they say: “That’s a sign of my bad luck.”
thag5.2:6.1: When a misfortune is extracted and beaten,
thag5.2:6.2: to surrender it in part would be like losing at dice;
thag5.2:6.3: but to surrender it all you’d have to be blind,
thag5.2:6.4: not seeing the even and the uneven.
thag5.2:7.1: You should only say what you would do;
thag5.2:7.2: you shouldn’t say what you wouldn’t do.
thag5.2:8.4: for one who does not act on it.
thag5.2:9.4: for one who acts on it.
